examples: What happens if an immovable object meets an unstoppable force?
The laws of physics make no preference for inertial frame of reference, so from my perspective here, I do not stir, and yet it's clear: the immovable object moves!
Straight outta the stomach and snuggled around the pancreas, you’ve got the relatively short and mostly immovable duodenum, which is where most of the chemical digestion occurs.

Of course, relativity clearly tells us that there is no such thing as an immovable object - here's why: If you pick any supposedly immovable object, or just something like your house or the earth, I can make it move.

examples: A state of mind, where you're totally engrossed in a task until you lose all sense of time.

words.defineEn: devote (oneself) fully to
words.defineVi: cống hiến (bản thân) đầy đủ cho
